1.name: The Young Philadelphians
1.description: A promising lawyer tries to handle his social and professional problems while climbing the ranks in Philadelphia.

2.name: Some Like It Hot
2.description: When two male musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.

3.name: Ben-Hur
3.description: When a Jewish prince is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend, he regains his freedom and comes back for revenge.

4.name: North by Northwest
4.description: A New York City advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies.

5.name: Anatomy of a Murder
5.description: In a murder trial, the defendant says he suffered temporary insanity after the victim raped his wife. What is the truth, and will he win his case?

6.name: Sleeping Beauty
6.description: After being snubbed by the royal family, a malevolent fairy places a curse on a princess which only a prince can break, along with the help of three good fairies.

7.name: Rio Bravo
7.description: A small-town sheriff in the American West enlists the help of a cripple, a drunk, and a young gunfighter in his efforts to hold in jail the brother of the local bad guy.

8.name: Les quatre cents coups
8.description: A young boy, left without attention, delves into a life of petty crime.

9.name: The World, The Flesh and The Devil
9.description: A miner trapped in a cave-in resurfaces, and upon discovering mankind has been wiped out in a nuclear holocaust, sets out to find other survivors.

10.name: Suddenly, Last Summer
10.description: The only son of wealthy widow Violet Venable dies while on vacation with his cousin Catherine. What the girl saw was so horrible that she went insane; now Mrs. Venable wants Catherine lobotomized to cover up the truth.

11.name: The 39 Steps
11.description: In London, a diplomat accidentally becomes involved in the death of a British agent who's after a spy ring that covets British military secrets.

12.name: Plan 9 from Outer Space
12.description: Evil aliens attack Earth and set their terrible "Plan 9" into action. As the aliens resurrect the dead of the Earth, the lives of the living are in danger.

13.name: Imitation of Life
13.description: An aspiring actress befriends a black widow, but trouble arises when the latter is rejected by her daughter, who tries to pass for white.

14.name: The Hanging Tree
14.description: Character study of a Doctor who saves a local criminal from a mob who are trying to hang him, but then tries to control the life of the young man, realizing that he can exploit his secret.

15.name: Operation Petticoat
15.description: During World War II, a commander finds himself stuck with a decrepit (and pink) submarine, a con man executive officer, and a group of army nurses.

16.name: Porgy and Bess
16.description: A woman whose past is scorned by nearly everyone around her meets a man who'd love her regardlessly- if only everyone else would allow them to.

17.name: Journey to the Center of the Earth
17.description: An Edinburgh professor and assorted colleagues follow an explorer's trail down an extinct Icelandic volcano to the earth's center.

18.name: Pillow Talk
18.description: A man and a woman who share a party line cannot stand each other, but he has fun romancing her with his voice disguised.

19.name: Expresso Bongo
19.description: Johnny Jackson, a sleazy talent agent, discovers teenager Bert Rudge singing in a coffee house. Despite Bert's protestation that he really is only interested in playing bongos, Johnny ...                See full summary »

20.name: Last Train from Gun Hill
20.description: A marshal tries to bring the son of an old friend, an autocratic cattle baron, to justice for his role in the rape and murder of the marshal's Native American wife.

21.name: On the Beach
21.description: After a global nuclear war, the residents of Australia must come to terms with the fact that all life will be destroyed in a matter of months.

22.name: Darby O'Gill and the Little People
22.description: A wily old codger matches wits with the King of the Leprechauns and helps play matchmaker for his daughter and the strapping lad who has replaced him as caretaker.

23.name: The Diary of Anne Frank
23.description: During World War II, a teenage Jewish girl named Anne Frank and her family are forced into hiding in the Nazi-occupied Netherlands.

24.name: House on Haunted Hill
24.description: A millionaire offers $10,000 to five people who agree to be locked in a large, spooky, rented house overnight with him and his wife.

25.name: The Horse Soldiers
25.description: In 1863, a Union outfit is sent behind Confederate lines in Mississippi to destroy enemy railroads but a captive southern belle and the unit's doctor cause frictions within ranks.

26.name: Orfeu Negro
26.description: A retelling of the Orpheus and Eurydice myth, set during the time of the Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro.

27.name: Die Brücke
27.description: In 1945, Germany is being overrun, and nobody is left to fight but teenagers.

28.name: Room at the Top
28.description: An ambitious young accountant plots to wed a wealthy factory owner's daughter, despite falling in love with a married older woman.

29.name: Teenagers from Outer Space
29.description: A young alien and a teenage earthling fall in love, and plot to stop the alien's race from using Earth as a food-breeding ground for giant lobsters from their planet.

30.name: Warlock
30.description: A famous gunman becomes the marshal of Warlock to end a gang's rampages, but is met with some opposition by a former gang member turned deputy sheriff who wants to follow only legal methods.

31.name: Hiroshima mon amour
31.description: A French actress filming an anti-war film in Hiroshima has an affair with a married Japanese architect as they share their differing perspectives on war.

32.name: No Name on the Bullet
32.description: When hired killer John Gant rides into Lordsburg, the town's folk become paranoid as each leading citizen has enemies capable of using the services of a professional killer for personal revenge.

33.name: The Devil's Disciple
33.description: The black sheep of a family and the local minister discover their true vocations during the Revolutionary War.

34.name: The Nun's Story
34.description: After leaving a wealthy Belgian family to become a nun, Sister Luke struggles with her devotion to her vows during crisis, disappointment, and World War II.

35.name: A Summer Place
35.description: A self-made businessman rekindles a romance with a former flame while their two teenage children begin a romance of their own with drastic consequences for both couples.

36.name: Les cousins
36.description: A pair of cousins share a flat, but animosity begins to build between the two when a woman gets involved.

37.name: Westbound
37.description: In 1864 Capt. John Hayes goes to Colorado to take over the stagecoach line and keep the flow of Western gold flowing and help the North win the Civil War.

38.name: The Shaggy Dog
38.description: A teenage boy is cursed with periodically turning into an sheepdog.

39.name: Life in Emergency Ward 10
39.description: A new registrar, with a revolutionary heart lung machine he has bought from America, joins a small county hospital, and has to win over his colleagues, including the senior house surgeon, ...                See full summary »

40.name: The Wild and the Innocent
40.description: In Wyoming, mountain trapper Yancy goes to the nearest town to trade his pelts but gets into trouble when he tries to save runaway saloon girl Rosalie from her shameful job.

41.name: Ningen no jôken
41.description: A Japanese pacifist, unable to face the dire consequences of conscientious objection, is transformed by his attempts to compromise with the demands of war-time Japan.

42.name: Solomon and Sheba
42.description: After becoming king of ancient Israel, Solomon faces threats coming from his jealous dispossessed brother Adonijah, the Egyptian Pharaoh and the scheming Queen of Sheba.

43.name: Gidget
43.description: A young girl discovers surfing and love (in that order) during one transitive summer.

44.name: Ercole e la regina di Lidia
44.description: While negotiating peace between two brothers contesting the throne of Thebes, an amnesiac Hercules is seduced by the evil Queen Omphale.

45.name: Pickpocket
45.description: Michel is released from jail after serving a sentence for thievery. His mother dies and he resorts to pickpocketing as a means of survival.

46.name: Ohayô
46.description: Two boys begin a silence strike to press their parents into buying them a television set.

47.name: Li'l Abner
47.description: As Sadie Hawkins Day approaches, Daisy Mae hopes to win the hand of Li'l Abner by catching him in the traditional race.

48.name: The Man Who Could Cheat Death
48.description: A centenarian artist and scientist in 1890 Paris maintains his youth and health by periodically replacing a gland with that of a living person.

49.name: The Atomic Submarine
49.description: Ships mysteriously disappear on route across the Arctic Sea, and a specially-equipped submarine is sent to investigate.

50.name: The Mummy
50.description: In 1895, British archaeologists find and open the tomb of Egyptian Princess Ananka with nefarious consequences.
